page.title: 10THE FORD
page.content: Fords were made for carts and people to go through in olden days as there were few bridges.The ford had to be shallow,but its' depth does vary depending on the time of year. The ford on our survey was beside Clappers Farm between {BRAMLEY and {SILCHESTER},so the river could be polluted by slurry from the farm,as well as by sticks,stones and other things people may have thrown in. The footbridge across the ford is quite high up,so perhaps the water rises quite a lot sometimes.The water in this ford is fast flowing. The ford is surrounded by North Copse,Clappers Farm,and the Basingstoke to Reading railway line. There are a lot of roads and footpaths leading to and from the ford probably because people had to come from all directions to cross the river here.
